item.title: Damaged barrier, 2nd October
item.description:
About a week ago these barriers were replaced due to a previous accident, i have just driven past them a already there a severe damage to the last barrier

item.title: Fly tipping, 2nd October
item.description:
In Milford towers thomes lane nouth second level is wear all the rubbish you can see this from thomes land next to bus stand what happened was on Tuesday 30 September I was going to home someone try to set light to the rubbish up there theres bins up there with rats running around the bins you have someone liveing there

item.title: Flytipping at the side and rear of our offices, 2nd October
item.description:
Old cooking appliances, cardboard and wooden pallets amongst other things dumped in rear alleyway and at Hartwell Street. Our office fire exit is blocked by an old kitchen appliance. Shop refurbishment at 21 Dalston Lane probable culprits.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dalston Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous obstruction of view of road., 2nd October
item.description:
Large flags and offensive posts restricting view of oncoming traffic at the roundabout coming through especially at speed from dual carriageway. I have already witnessed 2 near collisions in a matter of minutes with vehicles going around the roundabout.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queens Road, North End, London

item.title: Brondesbury Road, 2nd October
item.description:
I live on Brondesbury Road and pick up the litter from Mr Fish to my address all the time. From the Police Station all the along Harvist Road there's litter and the whole length of Brondesbury Road. Your street cleaners whom I've watched on three separate occasions just walk past it. I've just watched two together do it now and followed them not picking up anything. It's ridiculous.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brondesbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bag and wood dog poo in bag, 2nd October
item.description:
Bag full of rubbish, pieces of wood dog poo bag and lots of tissues at base of tree. It was bin collection day today. Why couldn’t the bin collectors take all the rubbish they see lying around? The base of tree is overgrown and covered in rubbish. Thankyou

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Culford Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
